result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Atty Michael Kapelis

10:54 AM Defendant Blake J Radtke in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by defendant, would like to get an attorney. Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. Court sets for Status of counsel on May 3, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:55 AM
Second appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on March 23, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:29 AM  Defendant Blake J Radtke appeared by phone, Attorney Gerise Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim is present in court. Def does not want an attorney for this case and requests to talk with the DA to see if a resolution can be met. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Status Hearing March 23, 2022 at 11:15 AM. No statement by victim.

Court Adjourned at 10:31 AM.

Def's dad called and stated the def just had six teeth pulled and his doctor requested him to try to do a virtual court appearance. Def's dad stated the def was not interested in getting an attorney and believed he would be representing himself. Def's dad was given the zoom information. Def dad was told to have the def call if he had any further questions. Def dad stated he understood and would get the zoom information to the def.
Second appearance on February 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

9:28 AM Defendant Blake J Radtke appeared in court, Attorney Bradford Paul Bollmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Def states he has an attorney and he is unable to be here today. Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY. Court will set for Status of Counsel on Feb 15, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Bond remain the same with an added condition of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 

Court adjourned at 9:30 AM
